    • Method Detail

      • convolvePointWithKernel

        public double convolvePointWithKernel​(algorithms.util.PairIntArray curve,
                                      int cIndex,
                                      float[] g,
                                      boolean calcX)
        convolve point[xyIdx] with the kernel g. if calcX is true, the point xPoints[xyIdx] is used, else yPoints[xyIdx]. minPointsValue is used for 'mu', the location parameter in the Gaussian during the convolution. Note that for extremely large range of point values, minPointsValue should probably the median of the points.
        Parameters:
        curve -
        cIndex -
        g -
        calcX -
        Returns:

      • convolvePointWithKernel

        public double convolvePointWithKernel​(float[][] img,
                                      int col,
                                      int row,
                                      float[] g,
                                      boolean calcX)
        convolve point[xyIdx] with the kernel g along a column if calcX is true, else along a row if calcX is false.
        Parameters:
        img -
        col -
        row -
        g -
        calcX - if true and if img is row major format (i.e. img[row][col]) then the convolution is over the column at the fixed row. if true and if img is col major format (i.e. img[col][row] as the Image.java etc classes use), then the convolution is also over the column at the fixed row. the converse is true if calcX is false.
        Returns:

      • convolvePointWithKernel

        public double convolvePointWithKernel​(double[][] img,
                                      int col,
                                      int row,
                                      double[] g,
                                      boolean calcX)
        convolve point[xyIdx] with the kernel g along a column if calcX is true, else along a row if calcX is false.
        Parameters:
        img -
        col -
        row -
        g -
        calcX - if true and if img is row major format (i.e. img[row][col]) then the convolution is over the column at the fixed row. if true and if img is col major format (i.e. img[col][row] as the Image.java etc classes use), then the convolution is also over the column at the fixed row. the converse is true if calcX is false.
        Returns:
